item.title: Lazarus hackers breach six companies in watering hole attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: In a recent espionage campaign, the infamous North Korean threat group Lazarus targeted multiple organizations in the software, IT, finance, and telecommunications sectors in South Korea. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes machine learning bug flagging Adobe emails as spam
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says it mitigated a known issue in one of its machine learning (ML) models that mistakenly flagged Adobe emails in Exchange Online as spam. [...]

item.title: Frederick Health data breach impacts nearly 1 million patients
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​A ransomware attack in January at Frederick Health Medical Group, a major healthcare provider in Maryland, has led to a data breach affecting nearly one million patients. [...]

item.title: Microsoft now pays up to $30,000 for some AI vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft announced an increase in bug bounty payouts to $30,000 for AI vulnerabilities found in Dynamics 365 and Power Platform services and products. [...]

item.title: Interlock ransomware claims DaVita attack, leaks stolen data
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Interlock ransomware gang has claimed the cyberattack on DaVita kidney dialysis firm and leaked data allegedly stolen from the organization. [...]

item.title: Yale New Haven Health data breach affects 5.5 million patients
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Yale New Haven Health (YNHHS) is warning that threat actors stole the personal data of 5.5 million patients in a cyberattack earlier this month. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes bug causing incorrect 0x80070643 WinRE errors
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says it resolved a known issue causing erroneous 0x80070643 installation failure errors when deploying the April 2025 Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) updates. [...]

item.title: Linux 'io_uring' security blindspot allows stealthy rootkit attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A significant security gap in Linux runtime security caused by the 'io_uring' interface allows rootkits to operate undetected on systems while bypassing advanced Enterprise security software. [...]

item.title: Russian army targeted by new Android malware hidden in mapping app
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Android malware has been discovered hidden inside trojanized versions of the Alpine Quest mapping app, which is reportedly used by Russian soldiers as part of war zone operational planning. [...]

item.title: WhatsApp's new Advanced Chat Privacy protects sensitive messages
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: WhatsApp has introduced a new Advanced Chat Privacy feature to protect sensitive information exchanged in private chats and group conversations. [...]

item.title: Blue Shield of California leaked health data of 4.7 million members to Google
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Blue Shield of California disclosed it suffered a data breach after exposing protected health information of 4.7 million members to Google's analytics and advertisement platforms. [...]

item.title: FBI: US lost record $16.6 billion to cybercrime in 2024
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The FBI says cybercriminals have stolen a record $16,6 billion in 2024, marking an increase in losses of over 33% compared to the previous year. [...]

item.title: ASUS releases fix for AMI bug that lets hackers brick servers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: ASUS has released security updates to address CVE-2024-54085, a maximum severity flaw that could allow attackers to hijack and potentially brick servers. [...]
